verses.chant_yoruba: Eji Ogbe dakun, mo wa gbe o. O nini, o nini, o nini...
verses.translation: Eji Ogbe please, I have come to praise you. The possessor of all things...
verses.message: This Odu signifies absolute victory, light, and awakening. The client is entering a period of unhindered success.
verses.prescription: Offer water and kolanut to Ori (Destiny).

verses.chant_yoruba: Oyeku yeku, oye oye. Oye ni owo, oye ni omo...
verses.translation: Darkness swirls, but wisdom prevents death. Wisdom brings wealth, wisdom brings children...
verses.message: This Odu warns of endings or separation but offers strong protection if the ancestors are appeased. It marks the end of a cycle.
verses.prescription: Feed the Elders of the Night (Iyaami) and seek ancestral blessings.

verses.chant_yoruba: Iwori, Iwori, a gba a. O gba a lowo olopolo...
verses.translation: Iwori cuts through the confusion. He takes it from the hands of the schemer...
verses.message: A time of careful examination. Things are not what they seem. Look deeper before making a decision.
verses.prescription: Use Shea Butter (Ori) to cool the head and offer to Esu.

verses.chant_yoruba: Odi di, Odi di. Odi ni owo, Odi ni omo...
verses.translation: The wall stands firm. The wall protects the wealth, the wall protects the children...
verses.message: This Odu speaks of strong protection and fertility. Your boundaries are secure, but ensure you do not isolate yourself.
verses.prescription: Offerings to Esu are vital to open the gate.

verses.chant_yoruba: Irosun, Irosun, a gba a. O gba a lowo aje...
verses.translation: Irosun sounds the warning. It saves us from the witches...
verses.message: You must be careful of pitfalls and depression. Honor your ancestors to avoid repeating their mistakes.
verses.prescription: Offer red cloth and camwood to the ancestors.

verses.translation: Owonrin reverses the evil. The head turns back...
verses.message: Be careful of chaos and sudden changes. What goes around comes around. Fix your character (Iwa).
verses.prescription: Offer to Esu to avert sudden misfortune.

verses.chant_yoruba: Obara ni owo, Obara ni ola...
verses.translation: Obara brings money, Obara brings honor...
verses.message: Prosperity is close, but you must overcome indecision and pride. Do not rest until the work is done.
verses.prescription: Offer honey and salt to bring sweetness to life.

verses.message: You may face a legal battle or a struggle for justice. Speak the truth, even if it is hard.
verses.prescription: Offer to Sango for justice and victory.

verses.message: The path is blocked, but force and determination will clear it. Victory in conflict is assured.
verses.prescription: Offer to Ogun (Iron) to clear obstacles.

verses.message: Sudden change is coming like a wind. Be respectful of powerful women and the spirit world.
verses.prescription: Offer fruits and sweets to the Mothers (Iyaami).

verses.message: Someone is trying to control or harm you. You must protect yourself against hidden wickedness.
verses.prescription: Offer a rooster to Esu to block evil intentions.

verses.message: You must have endurance. This Odu often speaks of pregnancy or carrying a heavy responsibility.
verses.prescription: Offer mild foods and prayers for health.

verses.message: Peace of mind comes from speaking the truth. Use your intelligence to solve the problem, not force.
verses.prescription: Offer white cloth and gin to Obatala.

verses.message: You are under pressure. Humility is your strength. Do not fight a battle you cannot win; bow to conquer.
verses.prescription: Offer to the Earth (Ile) and Sonponna.

verses.message: Victory over enemies through sweetness and charm. Love and money are highlighted.
verses.prescription: Offer honey, eggs, and prayers to Osun.

verses.message: Great miracles are possible. Generosity will open all doors. This is a very powerful and sacred Odu.
verses.prescription: Offer white foods (eggs, yam) to Obatala. Avoid red palm oil.

verses.translation: Ogbe Yeku, the father of mixed Odu...
verses.message: Light enters the darkness. This Odu marks the transition from trouble to relief. It is good for longevity.
verses.prescription: Offer a mature goat to Esu to secure long life.

verses.chant_yoruba: Ogbe wehin wo, bi o ba roro...
verses.translation: Ogbe looks back, if things are difficult...
verses.message: You must look back to understand the present. A mistake from the past needs correcting before you can move forward.
verses.prescription: Offer to the Earth (Ile) and appease the ancestors.

verses.chant_yoruba: Ogbe di kaka, o di kaka...
verses.translation: Ogbe becomes tight, it becomes tough...
verses.message: The situation is tight or difficult. You are being stubborn, or someone is being stubborn against you. Open the road.
verses.prescription: Offer snails and shea butter to calm the tension.

verses.translation: Ogbe sees the sleep, he sees the face...
verses.message: Do not believe everything you see. There is a deception or an illusion. Trust your inner vision (Ori) more than your eyes.
verses.prescription: Offer dried fish and kola nuts to Ifa.

verses.message: There is chaos in the home or family. You must return home to fix it. Do not travel until the home is settled.
verses.prescription: Offer to the family ancestors (Egungun).

verses.translation: Ogbe performs wonders, he takes the money...
verses.message: You are doing all the work while others take the credit. Avoid betrayal by friends. Your strength will eventually be recognized.
verses.prescription: Offer a rooster to Esu to expose the truth.

verses.message: You are facing unnecessary trouble because of blunt speech. Be quiet and observe. Silence will win the war.
verses.prescription: Offer padlocks and palm oil to Esu.

verses.translation: Ogbe of trouble, life has trouble...
verses.message: Do not meet force with force. Use patience. You are angry, but anger will cause you to lose the blessing.
verses.prescription: Offer akara (bean cakes) to the Elders.

verses.chant_yoruba: Ogbe sa, o sa fun iku...
verses.translation: Ogbe runs, he runs from death...
verses.message: A friend is acting like an enemy. There is a need to flee from a bad situation before it entraps you.
verses.prescription: Offer money and gin to Esu to clear the road for escape.

verses.message: You are surrounded by people who wish you ill, but they cannot harm you. You have spiritual immunity.
verses.prescription: Offer a he-goat to Esu.

verses.message: This Odu warns about the safety of a child or a new project. Give it extreme care and attention.
verses.prescription: Offer gifts to children.

verses.translation: Ogbe brings relief to the body...
verses.message: This is a very good Odu for healing. Physical and spiritual relief is coming. Peace of mind is assured.
verses.prescription: Offer coconut water and shea butter to Ori.

verses.message: You are entering a new phase of life or initiation. You must be humble and keep your secrets. Do not boast.
verses.prescription: Offer pigeons to Ifa.

verses.message: Victory is yours if you maintain spiritual purity. Do not engage in dirty fights; let the spirits fight for you.
verses.prescription: Offer water and white kola to Obatala.

verses.message: Prosperity is coming, but be careful of sharing too much information. Someone close is jealous of your rising success.
verses.prescription: Offer eggs and chalk (efun) to the Spirits.

verses.chant_yoruba: Oyeku logbe, o ni ki o gbe...
verses.translation: Oyeku strikes Ogbe, he says lift it...
verses.message: Darkness is lifted by a sudden flash of light. A solution appears unexpectedly. Protection from sudden death is assured.
verses.prescription: Offer a black hen and palm oil to Ifa.

verses.translation: Oyeku turns, we turn with it...
verses.message: There is confusion in the spiritual realm. You are seeing ghosts or feeling uneasy. Clarity will come through divination.
verses.prescription: Offer to the Egungun (Ancestors) to clear the confusion.

verses.translation: Oyeku blocks it, it becomes forgotten...
verses.message: A secret is being kept from you, or you are blocked by unseen forces. Do not reveal your plans to anyone.
verses.prescription: Offer a padlock and black cloth to Esu.

verses.translation: Oyeku sees sleep, he sees blood...
verses.message: This Odu often speaks of blood issues, menstrual pain, or ancestral debts that need paying. Rest is required.
verses.prescription: Offer red cloth and camwood to the Ancestors.

verses.translation: Oyeku crashes, he crashes the body...
verses.message: Beware of accidents or sudden reversals of fortune. Chaos is near. You must calm your head to avoid injury.
verses.prescription: Offer a tortoise to Esu to slow down the chaos.

verses.translation: Oyeku is flat, he kills wealth...
verses.message: You are feeling the weight of poverty or lack of resources. Resilience is key. The struggle will end if you remain humble.
verses.prescription: Offer bananas and honey to restore sweetness.

verses.message: Arguments will lead to destruction. Silence is your best weapon right now. Do not engage in court cases.
verses.prescription: Offer to Sango to handle the fight for you.

verses.translation: Oyeku finishes the bone, he cuts...
verses.message: There is a danger of surgery or cuts. Be careful with metal objects. This Odu also marks the end of a conflict through force.
verses.prescription: Offer roasted yam and palm oil to Ogun.

verses.message: Fear is chasing you. You feel hunted by spiritual forces. You must stand your ground or flee to safety.
verses.prescription: Offer eggs to the Elders of the Night.

verses.message: Someone is trying to hex you or restrain your progress. Their wickedness will turn back on them.
verses.prescription: Offer a he-goat to Esu.

verses.translation: Oyeku is cold, he is cold...
verses.message: This Odu warns of illness involving coldness or fever. Cover your body and seek warmth. Recovery is possible.
verses.prescription: Offer hot corn pap (Ogi) to Obatala.

verses.translation: Oyeku brings joy, it is fitting...
verses.message: Sadness is ending. Joy and relief are coming to the family. Good news will arrive in the morning.
verses.prescription: Offer white kola and gin to the Ancestors.

verses.message: There is a conspiracy against you at work or home. Be vigilant. Do not trust those who smile too much.
verses.prescription: Offer a cockerel to Esu to expose the plot.

verses.message: You are suffering for a cause, but victory will come. Your current hardship is a test of faith.
verses.prescription: Offer five eggs to Osun.

verses.message: Something thought dead will come back to life. A lost opportunity returns. This is a miracle Odu.
verses.prescription: Offer white cloth and yam to the Ancestors.

verses.message: You are starting a new spiritual journey. You must respect protocols. Do not rush; reflect before you act.
verses.prescription: Offer a pigeon and honey to Ifa.

verses.message: This Odu brings messages from the spirit world. You may feel drained. It is time to clear the energy in your home.
verses.prescription: Offer charcoal and roasted yam to Esu.

verses.message: There is a blockage or delay in your path. Travel is not advised right now. Sit still and wait for the road to clear.
verses.prescription: Offer a snail to Esu to slow down trouble.

verses.message: You are carrying a burden that belongs to your ancestors. Do not blame yourself for family patterns. Break the cycle.
verses.prescription: Offer red cloth to the Egungun.

verses.message: Resources are tight right now. You must budget carefully. Do not lend money, or it will not return.
verses.prescription: Offer bananas to Esu.

verses.message: You are worrying too much. Overthinking will not solve the problem. Take action and the fog will lift.
verses.prescription: Offer coconut water to your Head (Ori).

verses.message: You feel alone in your struggle. This is a test of bravery. Stand your ground, even if no one supports you.
verses.prescription: Offer spicy food to Sango.

verses.message: Anger will lead to regret. Do not use force to solve this issue. Put down the 'weapon' (words or physical) and talk.
verses.prescription: Offer palm wine to Ogun to cool him down.

verses.message: Conditions are changing rapidly. What was true yesterday is not true today. Adapt quickly or be blown away.
verses.prescription: Offer feathers to the wind (Esu).

verses.message: People are envious of you. They smile but hide knives. Protect yourself from the 'evil eye'.
verses.prescription: Offer a rooster to Esu for protection.

verses.message: Health issues may persist if not treated. Do not ignore minor symptoms. Persistence is required to heal.
verses.prescription: Offer healing herbs to Osanyin.

verses.message: The truth will liberate you. A family matter requires honest conversation. Lies will only make it worse.
verses.prescription: Offer white kola nuts to the Ancestors.

verses.message: Watch your step. You are walking into a trap set by arrogance. Be humble and check for pitfalls.
verses.prescription: Offer to the Earth (Ile).

verses.message: A miracle is coming. Keep your environment clean and white. Generosity will bring unexpected rewards.
verses.prescription: Offer white chalk (Efun) and water to Obatala.

verses.message: You will find victory through beauty or art. Decorate your surroundings. Attraction is your power now.
verses.prescription: Offer sweets and brass to Osun.

verses.message: Do not turn your back on your enemy. There is a risk of betrayal or theft while you are not looking. Be vigilant.
verses.prescription: Offer a mirror and a rooster to Esu.

verses.message: A long-standing illness or blockage is coming to an end. The suffering has been walled off. Recovery is near.
verses.prescription: Offer clothes of the sick person to Esu.

verses.message: You are looking for a secret that is hidden behind a wall. Investigation is needed. Spiritual sight is blocked.
verses.prescription: Offer clean water and eyes of a snail to Ifa.

verses.message: You are dreaming but not acting. Laziness or delay is blocking your success. Wake up and work.
verses.prescription: Offer coffee or bitter kola to wake up your Ori.

verses.message: There is a hunger or lack in the house. The wall prevents provisions from entering. You must open the gate.
verses.prescription: Offer food to the poor and to Esu.

verses.message: You are sitting on the fence. Indecision is your enemy. You promised something you have not delivered.
verses.prescription: Fulfill your promises to avoid blockage.

verses.message: You are being too stubborn. The wall you built to protect yourself is now a prison. Break down the wall of pride.
verses.prescription: Offer a thunderbolt (stone) to Sango.

verses.message: Defensive violence may be necessary. Someone is trying to break your wall. Stand firm and fight back.
verses.prescription: Offer iron and roasted yam to Ogun.

verses.message: The blockage is blown away by the wind. If you are feeling trapped, an opportunity to escape is coming.
verses.prescription: Offer to Oya (Wind) to remove barriers.

verses.message: There is a danger of physical restraint or jail. Do not break the law. Someone is trying to tie you down.
verses.prescription: Offer a chain to Esu and then throw it away.

verses.message: This is the Odu of the womb. It speaks of carrying a child or a heavy burden safely to term. Protection is strong.
verses.prescription: Offer eggs and soft yam to Osun.

verses.message: The blockage is removed peacefully. Tension is released. You will find relief from the pressure you have been feeling.
verses.prescription: Offer white kola and water to Esu.

verses.message: You must lower your defenses to win. Being too rigid will cause you to break. Establish a new foundation.
verses.prescription: Offer to the Earth (Ile).

verses.message: Fertility and love are highlighted. The 'blockage' was actually a protection for something growing inside. Victory in love.
verses.prescription: Offer sweets and perfume to Osun.

verses.message: A great wealth is hidden behind the wall. A miracle is coming that will break all barriers. Be generous.
verses.prescription: Offer white pigeons to Obatala.

verses.message: You are carrying a heavy load for others. While noble, ensure you do not collapse under the weight. Support is reciprocal.
verses.prescription: Offer a woven basket and yam to Esu.

verses.message: The sun is setting on a problem. Honor the ancestors to ensure a peaceful transition. A cycle is closing.
verses.prescription: Offer red cloth and a lamp to the Ancestors.

verses.message: You are hearing things that are not there, or worrying about rumors. Clear your mind. The noise is a distraction.
verses.prescription: Offer a bell to Esu to clear the sound.

verses.message: Your vision is blocked by a wall. Do not rush forward, or you will hit it. Patience is the only key right now.
verses.prescription: Offer snails to Obatala for patience.

verses.message: Be careful of accidents involving the feet or walking. Chaos may come from a journey. Watch your step.
verses.prescription: Offer a pair of shoes or sandals to Esu.

verses.message: You are expecting money or help that may not arrive. The promise is empty. Rely on your own strength.
verses.prescription: Offer salt and water to Ori.

verses.message: Emotional pain is present. You feel unappreciated. Do not let bitterness take root in your heart.
verses.prescription: Offer sweets and honey to Osun to heal the heart.

verses.message: This Odu is specific to women's health and cycles. It also warns of cutting ties abruptly. Healing is needed.
verses.prescription: Offer red cloth and gin to Ogun.

verses.message: Depression is chasing you like a dark wind. You want to run away from everything. Seek community support.
verses.prescription: Offer feathers to the wind (Esu) to blow away sadness.

verses.message: Wicked people are working at night against you. You must protect your sleep and your dreams.
verses.prescription: Offer a candle and water at your bedside.

verses.message: A child or a pregnancy needs protection. There is a risk of bleeding or weakness. Warmth and care are required.
verses.prescription: Offer a hen to the Ancestors.

verses.message: The red anxiety washes away. Peace returns to the mind. Ancestral blessings bring relief.
verses.prescription: Offer white cloth to Obatala.

verses.message: You are walking in the footsteps of your ancestors. Do not deviate from the family tradition. Respect the past.
verses.prescription: Offer libation to the earth (Ile).

verses.message: Beauty may hide danger. Be careful of attraction that leads to pain. Not all that glitters is gold.
verses.prescription: Offer honey to Osun but taste it first.

verses.message: A mix of suffering and joy. The red (blood/struggle) turns into white (peace/miracle). Keep faith.
verses.prescription: Offer white eggs and red palm oil to Esu.

verses.message: To get what you want, you must give something up. An exchange is necessary. Do not be stingy, or you will lose everything.
verses.prescription: Offer clothes or money to the poor.

verses.message: A dangerous situation is reversed. Death or illness passed over you. Thank your ancestors for their intervention.
verses.prescription: Offer a rooster to Esu and food to the Egungun.

verses.message: The weather of your life is changing. Confusion is clearing up. What looked like a disaster turns into a blessing.
verses.prescription: Offer corn and water to Esu.

verses.message: You are blocked because you refused to listen. You must return to the source of the problem to fix it.
verses.prescription: Offer a padlock and key to Esu.

verses.message: Be careful of accidents involving blood. Past actions are coming back to haunt you. Clean your karma.
verses.prescription: Offer red cloth and a cock to Ogun.

verses.message: You are experiencing a reversal of wealth. Money is tight. Hard work will restore your balance, but do not borrow.
verses.prescription: Offer bananas and honey to Ori.

verses.message: A court case or argument turns around. The accuser becomes the accused. Justice is swift.
verses.prescription: Offer to Sango for victory in legal matters.

verses.message: Danger of metal or machinery. A sudden conflict may arise. Use your head to avoid a physical fight.
verses.prescription: Offer roasted yam and palm oil to Ogun.

verses.message: The wind of change is blowing things upside down. Spiritual attacks are reversed back to the sender.
verses.prescription: Offer eggs and breeze (feathers) to the Mothers.

verses.message: You reap what you sow. If you have done evil, it returns. If you are good, protection surrounds you.
verses.prescription: Offer a he-goat to Esu.

verses.message: A child is sick or there is a cold illness in the house. Warmth and motherly care are needed to reverse it.
verses.prescription: Offer soft yam and palm oil to the Ancestors.

verses.message: Mental chaos is settled. Peace of mind returns after a period of turmoil. Listen to advice.
verses.prescription: Offer white kola and water to Ori.

verses.message: You stepped into a hole because you were looking too high. Humility is forced upon you. Learn the lesson.
verses.prescription: Offer to the Earth (Ile).

verses.message: Bad luck is turned into victory through charm and beauty. A relationship takes a surprising turn.
verses.prescription: Offer sweets and brass to Osun.

verses.message: Sudden wealth or a miracle reverses a bad situation. Be generous when the blessing arrives.
verses.prescription: Offer white food (eggs/yam) to Obatala.

verses.message: Respect your elders and those who came before you. Your wealth is tied to how you treat your superiors. Clarity is coming.
verses.prescription: Offer a pigeon to your Head (Ori) for clear vision.

verses.message: The period of poverty or stagnation is dying. Ancestral wealth or a forgotten inheritance is revealed. Sleep well to receive the message.
verses.prescription: Offer food to the Egungun (Ancestors).

verses.message: Good for commerce and selling. If business has been slow, it will pick up. Clear the confusion in your accounting.
verses.prescription: Offer honey and corn to Esu to attract customers.

verses.message: You are blocked by debt or an unfulfilled promise. You feel tied down. Pay what you owe to move forward.
verses.prescription: Offer a chain or padlock to Esu, then break it.

verses.message: Do not chase 'fool's gold.' What looks like a great opportunity is a deception. Watch out for blood pressure issues.
verses.prescription: Offer red cloth to the Spirits.

verses.message: Chaos in the head leads to chaos in the pocket. A sudden reversal of fortune is possible. Stay calm.
verses.prescription: Offer a tortoise to Esu to stabilize the situation.

verses.message: Your ego is writing checks your body cannot cash. Arguments will lead to a fall. Be humble or be humbled.
verses.prescription: Offer a rooster to Sango.

verses.message: Victory comes through force and determination. You must cut ties with lazy people. A warning about sharp objects.
verses.prescription: Offer roasted yam and palm oil to Ogun.

verses.message: Someone is planning to run away with your money or trust. Fraud is indicated. Secure your assets.
verses.prescription: Offer to Esu to catch the thief.

verses.message: Enemies are envious of your potential wealth. They are trying to circle you. Break the circle.
verses.prescription: Offer a he-goat to Esu.

verses.message: Wealth brings heavy responsibilities that may affect your health. Do not neglect your body for money.
verses.prescription: Offer fruits and soft food to the Ancestors.

verses.message: Financial worries are easing. Peace of mind returns. A message of good news regarding work is coming.
verses.prescription: Offer white kola and water to Ori.

verses.message: You are under pressure to perform. Do not let pride make you stumble. Step carefully and be humble.
verses.prescription: Offer to the Earth (Ile).

verses.message: Victory in love and money. Your charm is working. A relationship brings prosperity.
verses.prescription: Offer sweets and brass to Osun.

verses.message: Great wealth is coming, but it must be shared. The miracle happens when you open your hand to give.
verses.prescription: Offer white items to Obatala.

verses.message: You are hunting for success, but you must follow the rules. Shortcuts will lead to a trap. Justice is watching.
verses.prescription: Offer a dog or iron to Ogun for a successful hunt.

verses.message: A long legal battle or dispute is coming to a close. The ancestors have judged the case. Peace follows the verdict.
verses.prescription: Offer food to the Egungun (Ancestors).

verses.message: A secret is being kept that is causing trouble. You must speak the truth to break the curse. Investigation is needed.
verses.prescription: Offer clear water and a white candle to Ifa.

verses.message: You are stuck in a legal or bureaucratic deadlock. Stubbornness on both sides is the cause. Someone must yield.
verses.prescription: Offer a snail to Esu to lubricate the situation.

verses.message: Arguments in the family are heating up. Bad blood is rising. Be careful of speaking words you cannot take back.
verses.prescription: Offer red cloth and cooling water to the Ancestors.

verses.message: A sudden accident or argument reverses your progress. Chaos is present. Stay calm and do not react to provocation.
verses.prescription: Offer a tortoise to Esu.

verses.message: Pride goes before a fall. You are struggling financially because you refuse to ask for help. Drop your ego.
verses.prescription: Offer bananas and honey to Esu.

verses.message: Justice will be served through force if necessary. This Odu speaks of winning a battle decisively. Victory is sure.
verses.prescription: Offer iron and palm oil to Ogun.

verses.message: A storm is coming. You may need to flee a bad situation to avoid legal trouble. Do not stay where you are not wanted.
verses.prescription: Offer feathers to the Wind (Oya).

verses.message: You are being judged unfairly. Wicked people are trying to use the law against you. Protection against jail is needed.
verses.prescription: Offer a he-goat to Esu.

verses.message: A child or mother is suffering. The trouble is persistent. You need endurance to see this through to the end.
verses.prescription: Offer soft yam to the Earth.

verses.message: The verdict is in your favor. The truth has set you free. Relief from legal or family pressure is here.
verses.prescription: Offer white kola nuts to Ori.

verses.message: You are under pressure and may step into a trap if you are not humble. Do not let pride blind you to danger.
verses.prescription: Offer to the Earth (Ile).

verses.message: You are being pressured to act. Do not step into the trap. Humility will save you from a crushing defeat.
verses.prescription: Offer to the Earth (Ile).

verses.message: A legal victory brings joy. You will conquer your accusers. Beauty and truth are on your side.
verses.prescription: Offer sweets to Osun.

verses.message: Speak the truth and a miracle will happen. A generous gift resolves a long-standing conflict.
verses.prescription: Offer white eggs and chalk to Obatala.

verses.message: There is a risk of treason or betrayal by someone close. You must clear the path carefully. Victory is assured if you are vigilant.
verses.prescription: Offer a rooster to Ogun to expose the traitor.

verses.message: A surgery or medical intervention may be necessary to save a life. The war is ending. Death is averted through iron.
verses.prescription: Offer roasted yam and iron to Ogun.

verses.message: Jealousy is causing confusion. Someone is eyeing your success with envy. You must cut through the lies to see the truth.
verses.prescription: Offer a machete to Esu to cut the envy.

verses.message: You are trapped, but you have the strength to break the wall. Do not accept confinement. Fight for your freedom.
verses.prescription: Offer iron and a key to Esu.

verses.message: There is a strong warning of bleeding or accidents at work. Be careful with tools. The ancestors are demanding attention.
verses.prescription: Offer red cloth and palm oil to Ogun.

verses.message: Chaos caused by anger. Revenge will only lead to an accident. Cool your temper before you destroy what you have built.
verses.prescription: Offer snails to cool the head.

verses.message: Hard work brings wealth. Do not be lazy. Your strength will be rewarded with profit. A business breakthrough is near.
verses.prescription: Offer palm wine and honey to Ogun.

verses.message: A severe argument may turn physical. Walk away from the fight. You are right, but the cost of proving it is too high.
verses.prescription: Offer a rooster to Sango.

verses.message: Good for building a house or starting a construction project. Do not let the winds of change deter you. Build a solid foundation.
verses.prescription: Offer a cock to the foundation of the house.

verses.message: Danger of police trouble or arrest. Someone is trying to restrain you. You need strong protection against wickedness.
verses.prescription: Offer a he-goat to Esu.

verses.message: The body is weak and may require surgery or strong medicine. Recovery will be slow but sure if you follow doctor's orders.
verses.prescription: Offer vegetables and healing herbs.

verses.message: Victory leads to peace and wealth. The war is over. Put down your weapons and enjoy the spoils.
verses.prescription: Offer white cloth and gin to Ogun.

verses.message: You are trying to force a situation that requires gentleness. You will be trapped if you use aggression. Be humble.
verses.prescription: Offer to the Earth (Ile).

verses.message: Creative work will bring victory. You are crafting your own destiny. Success in artistic or mechanical endeavors.
verses.prescription: Offer sweets and tools to Ogun and Osun.

verses.message: A miraculous restoration of what was lost. The struggle ends with a generous gift. Be thankful.
verses.prescription: Offer white yam and palm oil.

verses.message: You are carrying a heavy load and feel like you have no home. The wind is blowing you around. Seek stability.
verses.prescription: Offer a pigeon to your Head (Ori) for direction.

verses.message: The wind blows cold from the cemetery. There is stagnation or a threat of death in the family. Appease the ancestors immediately.
verses.prescription: Offer food and red cloth to the Egungun.

verses.message: You are trying to see clearly in a storm. Confusion surrounds you. Wait for the dust to settle before making a choice.
verses.prescription: Offer water to Esu to settle the dust.

verses.message: Spiritual forces are blocking your path. It feels like you are tied up. This is likely the work of witchcraft or negative energy.
verses.prescription: Offer a chain and he-goat to Esu.

verses.message: You are feeling drained of energy, like blood dripping away. Depression or menstrual pain is indicated. Seek rest.
verses.prescription: Offer red items to the Mothers (Iyami).

verses.message: A storm is coming that will turn everything upside down. Beware of accidents during travel. Chaos is in the air.
verses.prescription: Offer a tortoise to Esu to stabilize your path.

verses.message: You are chasing wealth in the wind. Schemes and get-rich-quick plans will fail. Indecision is costing you money.
verses.prescription: Offer honey and bananas to Ori.

verses.message: A conflict with a powerful woman or spiritual force. You are speaking the truth, but it is causing a storm.
verses.prescription: Offer sweets and eggs to the Mothers to cool the fight.

verses.message: The wind carries the sound of war. Violence or aggressive change is coming. Prepare for a battle to clear the air.
verses.prescription: Offer iron to Ogun and breeze to Oya.

verses.message: You are surrounded by wicked intentions. Sorcery is being used to restrain you. You must break the circle.
verses.prescription: Offer a he-goat to Esu for strong protection.

verses.message: Pregnancy or illness is at risk due to spiritual interference. The carrier is weak. Extreme care is needed.
verses.prescription: Offer soft yam and palm oil to the Earth.

verses.message: The storm has passed. Peace returns to the land. The truth has blown away the lies.
verses.prescription: Offer white cloth to Oya and Obatala.

verses.message: Do not fight the wind. Bend like the reed or you will break. Humility allows you to survive the change.
verses.prescription: Offer to the Earth (Ile).

verses.message: You will conquer through charm, not force. A beautiful woman brings luck or change. Victory is sweet.
verses.prescription: Offer honey and brass to Osun.

verses.message: A miracle rides on the wind. Unexpected generosity solves your problems. Keep your spirit white and pure.
verses.prescription: Offer white pigeons to Obatala.

verses.message: There is a warning of theft or loss. Do not carry what does not belong to you. Protection is needed for your possessions.
verses.prescription: Offer a padlock and a he-goat to Esu.

verses.message: The wicked will meet their end. Judgment is coming. If you are innocent, you have nothing to fear from the darkness.
verses.prescription: Offer food to the Elders of the Night.

verses.message: People are watching you with envious eyes. Wickedness is hidden behind a smile. Be careful who you trust with your plans.
verses.prescription: Offer dried fish and palm oil to Ifa.

verses.message: You are feeling hemmed in or restrained. There is a danger of imprisonment or being trapped by your own actions.
verses.prescription: Offer a chain to Esu and break it.

verses.message: The blood of the innocent cries out. Do not participate in wicked acts. Ancestral guilt may be affecting you.
verses.prescription: Offer red cloth to the Ancestors.

verses.message: A wicked plan will backfire. The trap set for you will catch the setter. Chaos reverses the evil intention.
verses.prescription: Offer a tortoise to Esu.

verses.message: Do not use your power to oppress others. Pride will lead to a downfall. Use your wealth to help, not harm.
verses.prescription: Offer bananas and honey to Ori.

verses.message: Justice is coming for the wicked. A dispute will end in punishment for the guilty party. Speak the truth to be saved.
verses.prescription: Offer a rooster to Sango.

verses.message: Violence is used to restrain the enemy. You must fight to protect your boundaries. Iron meets wickedness.
verses.prescription: Offer iron and palm oil to Ogun.

verses.message: You are running from a spiritual attack. Sorcery is involved. Flee the environment if you feel unsafe.
verses.prescription: Offer eggs to the Mothers (Iyami) for protection.

verses.message: This Odu warns against abortion or harm to a child. The womb is under spiritual surveillance. Protect the pregnant.
verses.prescription: Offer soft yam and palm oil to the Earth.

verses.message: The restraints are loosened. You are free from the control of wicked people. Peace of mind returns.
verses.prescription: Offer white kola and water to Esu.

verses.message: Do not set traps for others, or you will fall into them yourself. Humility is your shield against wickedness.
verses.prescription: Offer to the Earth (Ile).

verses.message: A beautiful person may have a wicked heart. Do not be deceived by appearances. Use charm to disarm your enemies.
verses.prescription: Offer sweets to Osun.

verses.message: Even the wicked must bow to the generous. A miracle will restore what was stolen. Keep your hands clean.
verses.prescription: Offer white items to Obatala.

verses.message: You are carrying a precious burden (child or project). Safe delivery is promised if you offer sacrifice. Do not be careless.
verses.prescription: Offer a goat to Ifa for safe delivery.

verses.message: This Odu gives strong health and protection against death. It speaks of strong bones and longevity. The sick will recover.
verses.prescription: Offer bone marrow and food to the Elders.

verses.message: You must examine the environment before you settle. A burden requires careful planning. Look before you leap.
verses.prescription: Offer to the Earth (Ile) before building.

verses.message: There is a risk of blockage in childbirth or a project. The path is tight. You need spiritual help to open the gate.
verses.prescription: Offer snails and oil to Esu.

verses.message: The ancestors are supporting you in carrying this load. Endurance is in your bloodline. Do not give up.
verses.prescription: Offer red cloth and yam to the Egungun.

verses.message: The structure is weak. There is a danger of collapse (physical or metaphorical). Reinforce your foundation immediately.
verses.prescription: Offer a tortoise and cement/stone to Esu.

verses.message: You are working hard to carry the weight of wealth. It is heavy, but the reward is great. Keep pushing.
verses.prescription: Offer honey and bananas to Ori.

verses.message: You are struggling against opposition to maintain your position. Persistence will win the argument. Stand firm.
verses.prescription: Offer a rooster to Sango.

verses.message: Surgery may be needed to fix a bone or structural issue. Iron strengthens the body. Victory through endurance.
verses.prescription: Offer iron and roasted yam to Ogun.

verses.message: The wind threatens to blow away what you are carrying. Protect your cargo from spiritual storms.
verses.prescription: Offer feathers to Oya.

verses.message: Wicked people are trying to harm a pregnancy or a new venture. High alert is needed. Shield the vulnerable.
verses.prescription: Offer a he-goat to Esu.

verses.message: The burden is lifted. Healing has arrived. After a long period of endurance, you will find rest.
verses.prescription: Offer white kola and water to Ori.

verses.message: The load is heavy enough to crush you if you are arrogant. Bow down to the earth to find the strength to carry it.
verses.prescription: Offer to the Earth (Ile).

verses.message: Endurance leads to victory. A child brings joy to the house. The suffering was worth the reward.
verses.prescription: Offer sweets and brass to Osun.

verses.message: A miraculous birth or creation. What you are carrying is a gift from the gods. Be generous.
verses.prescription: Offer white items to Obatala.

verses.message: Victory comes through the head (intelligence). However, be careful of betrayal by a friend. Use your mind, not your fists.
verses.prescription: Offer a coconut and water to Ori.

verses.message: This Odu promises long life and victory over death. A serious illness will be cured. Peace returns to the family.
verses.prescription: Offer cold water and white cloth to Obatala.

verses.message: Character is beauty. If you investigate the matter deeply, you will find the truth. Do not judge by appearances.
verses.prescription: Offer soap and water to Esu to wash away bad luck.

verses.message: You were stuck, but the truth has set you free. The blockage is removed. Travel is now safe.
verses.prescription: Offer a key and oil to Esu.

verses.message: Spiritual cleansing is needed. The ancestors are asking for attention. Clear the altar and your mind.
verses.prescription: Offer white cloth and gin to the Egungun.

verses.message: A chaotic situation is calmed by wisdom. A loss is recovered through intelligence. Do not panic.
verses.prescription: Offer a tortoise to Esu.

verses.message: Honest business brings wealth. Prosperity comes when you share your profits. Do not be greedy.
verses.prescription: Offer bananas and honey to Ori.

verses.message: The verdict is in. Truth wins over force. A dispute is settled in your favor if you stay calm.
verses.prescription: Offer white kola nuts to Esu.

verses.message: Victory is achieved, and now it is time for peace. Put down the sword. Iron is used to build, not destroy.
verses.prescription: Offer roasted yam and palm oil to Ogun.

verses.message: The wind carries the truth far and wide. Secrets are revealed. Embrace the change, do not run from it.
verses.prescription: Offer feathers to Oya.

verses.message: Your calm demeanor disarms your enemies. Wickedness cannot penetrate the shield of truth. You are protected.
verses.prescription: Offer a he-goat to Esu.

verses.message: Endurance brings peace. Care for the weak or sick is a sacred duty. Your health will improve.
verses.prescription: Offer soft yam and oil to the Earth.

verses.message: Humility brings peace of mind. Do not trample on others. A lesson learned in silence is valuable.
verses.prescription: Offer to the Earth (Ile).

verses.message: Religious or spiritual victory. Beauty and truth combine to bring success. Your prayers are answered.
verses.prescription: Offer sweets and white cloth to Osun and Obatala.

verses.message: The truth brings a miracle. Be generous with your knowledge and wealth. The white cloth of peace covers you.
verses.prescription: Offer white items to Obatala.

verses.message: We must humble ourselves to enter the house of wealth. Arrogance will ruin you. A sacrifice is needed to remove bad luck.
verses.prescription: Offer a pigeon and bury it for the Earth.

verses.message: This Odu averts death and brings peace to a chaotic situation. Patience and calmness are required to heal.
verses.prescription: Offer a snail and water to the Earth.

verses.message: You are undergoing a spiritual initiation or learning a deep secret. Do not rush the process. True vision requires humility.
verses.prescription: Offer kola nuts to Ifa.

verses.message: You are refusing to let go of something that binds you. The trap is set. Liberation comes from releasing the grudge.
verses.prescription: Offer a padlock and key to Esu.

verses.message: You are carrying the pain of the past. The ancestors want you to drop this burden. Humility heals old wounds.
verses.prescription: Offer red cloth and camwood to the Egungun.

verses.message: Chaos is grinding you down. A sudden reversal of plans is necessary. Slow down before you crash.
verses.prescription: Offer a tortoise to Esu.

verses.message: You are working hard for wealth, but pride may block the blessing. Share your success with the community.
verses.prescription: Offer honey and bananas to Ori.

verses.message: You are diving into a conflict that is deeper than you think. There is a risk of drowning in legal trouble. Seek mediation.
verses.prescription: Offer a rooster to Sango.

verses.message: Violence or aggressive cutting is threatened. You must protect yourself from physical harm. Do not be afraid, but be prepared.
verses.prescription: Offer iron and palm oil to Ogun.

verses.message: The wind blows away the chaff. You must let go of what is leaving your life. Running away may be the only option.
verses.prescription: Offer feathers to Oya.

verses.message: You reap what you sow. Wickedness will be restrained by the Earth. Be careful of farming or land disputes.
verses.prescription: Offer a he-goat to Esu.

verses.message: A sickness comes from the damp earth. The body is cold. Warmth and care are needed to restore health.
verses.prescription: Offer hot corn pap to Obatala.

verses.message: This is a sign of great happiness and victory. The crushing weight is lifted, and peace remains.
verses.prescription: Offer white kola and gin to Ori.

verses.message: Beauty emerges from the mud. Do not despise humble beginnings. A woman brings luck to the home.
verses.prescription: Offer sweets to Osun.

verses.message: The house is blessed. A miracle strengthens the foundation of your home. Everything you touch turns white (peaceful).
verses.prescription: Offer white chalk and yam to the Earth.

verses.message: Victory is supported by destiny. Good fortune is coming to your house. Your head (Ori) agrees with your success.
verses.prescription: Offer kola nuts and water to Ori.

verses.message: Sorrow is turned into joy. The ancestors are pleased. A looming death or failure is averted by a sweet sacrifice.
verses.prescription: Offer honey and fruits to the Ancestors.

verses.message: You are transforming a messy situation into a work of art. Use your creativity. Beauty will open doors for you.
verses.prescription: Offer flowers and sweets to Osun.

verses.message: Happiness is momentarily blocked. You are waiting for a child or a lover. Patience will break the barrier.
verses.prescription: Offer snails to Esu.

verses.message: Issues with blood or reproductive health. Love requires sacrifice. Do not let depression steal your joy.
verses.prescription: Offer red cloth and honey to the Spirits.

verses.message: A bad situation is reversed into a victory. The storm passes, leaving sweetness behind. Be grateful.
verses.prescription: Offer a tortoise to Esu.

verses.message: Work becomes play. You will make money doing what you love. Your charm attracts customers.
verses.prescription: Offer honey and pigeons to Ori.

verses.message: A lovers' quarrel. Jealousy causes conflict. Do not fight fire with fire; use sweetness to calm the anger.
verses.prescription: Offer sweets and eggs to Esu.

verses.message: Victory over enemies is certain. You will conquer them completely. The war ends in celebration.
verses.prescription: Offer a rooster and palm wine to Ogun.

verses.message: The wind brings change. A woman with spiritual power influences your life. Respect the Mothers.
verses.prescription: Offer feathers and eggs to Oya.

verses.message: Use your charm to restrain your enemies. Wickedness cannot stand against true joy. You are protected.
verses.prescription: Offer a he-goat to Esu.

verses.message: A mother carries a child with joy. Endurance leads to a safe delivery. Health improves.
verses.prescription: Offer soft yam and oil to the Earth.

verses.message: This is the Odu of wealth and peace. Victory is sweet. You have overcome the struggle.
verses.prescription: Offer white cloth and gin to Obatala.

verses.message: Humility brings a harvest of joy. Do not step on others to get to the top. The earth supports you.
verses.prescription: Offer to the Earth (Ile).

verses.message: A miracle of love or money. The moon shines on you. Be generous with your good fortune.
verses.prescription: Offer white items to Obatala.

verses.message: Ofun breathes life into destiny. Something thought dead is resurrected. A new beginning is gifted to you.
verses.prescription: Offer white kola and water to Ori.

verses.message: The ultimate protection against death. A miracle saves the sick. Old age is promised.
verses.prescription: Offer a white goat to Obatala.

verses.message: Wisdom comes from deep listening. Herbal medicine will cure the ailment. Use your spiritual vision.
verses.prescription: Offer herbs and gin to Osanyin.

verses.message: The blockage is removed by a miracle. What was closed is now open. Fertility is restored.
verses.prescription: Offer snails to Esu.

verses.message: Light enters the darkness. The ancestors send a gift. Depression lifts like mist before the sun.
verses.prescription: Offer white cloth to the Egungun.

verses.message: Chaos is instantly reversed by a miracle. A sudden stroke of luck changes everything. Be ready.
verses.prescription: Offer a tortoise to Esu.

verses.message: Wealth expands greatly. You are blessed to be a blessing. Do not let pride taint your white cloth.
verses.prescription: Offer white pigeons to Ori.

verses.message: Divine justice prevails. The verdict is truth. You are vindicated by the spirits.
verses.prescription: Offer white kola nuts to Sango.

verses.message: A necessary surgery brings healing. The cut is clean. Victory over illness through iron and white cloth.
verses.prescription: Offer iron to Ogun and snail water to Obatala.

verses.message: The breath of life returns. The wind blows away the evil, leaving only purity. Spiritual elevation.
verses.prescription: Offer feathers to Oya.

verses.message: A white shield protects you from wickedness. The spell is broken by purity. You are untouchable.
verses.prescription: Offer a he-goat to Esu.

verses.message: A miraculous birth. A child born under this Odu has a special destiny. Great care must be taken.
verses.prescription: Offer soft yam and shea butter.

verses.message: Peace and wealth flow together. Giving leads to receiving. A time of great abundance.
verses.prescription: Offer white cloth and gin to Obatala.

verses.message: The earth yields its riches to the humble. A miracle springs from the ground. Be grateful.
verses.prescription: Offer to the Earth (Ile).

verses.message: The creation of beauty is a miracle. Joy fills the home. Everything you do is blessed with sweetness.
verses.prescription: Offer sweets and white cloth to Osun and Obatala.
